Interface OrderRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Order,Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Order,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Order,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Order,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Order,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Order>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Order,Integer>
public interface OrderRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Order,Integer>
Repository interface for performing CRUD operations on Order entities. Extends JpaRepository to inherit standard database interaction methods and includes custom query methods.

  • Method Details

    • findByCustomerId

      List<Order> findByCustomerId(Integer customerID)
      Retrieves all orders associated with a specific customer.
      Parameters:
      customerID - The ID of the customer.
      Returns:
      A list of Order entities linked to the specified customer.

    • findByEmployeeId

      List<Order> findByEmployeeId(Integer employeeID)
      Retrieves all orders associated with a specific employee.
      Parameters:
      employeeID - The ID of the employee.
      Returns:
      A list of Order entities linked to the specified employee.

    • findByTimeRange

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Order o WHERE o.time >= :startTime AND o.time <= :endTime") List<Order> findByTimeRange(@Param("startTime") Instant startTime, @Param("endTime") Instant endTime, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Retrieves orders within a specific time range, with pagination support.
      Parameters:
      startTime - The start time of the range (inclusive).
      endTime - The end time of the range (inclusive).
      pageable - The pagination details (e.g., page size, page number).
      Returns:
      A paginated list of Order entities within the specified time range.

    • findByStatus

      List<Order> findByStatus(String status)
      Retrieves all orders with a specific status.
      Parameters:
      status - The status to filter orders by (e.g., "completed", "pending").
      Returns:
      A list of Order entities matching the specified status.

    • getRevenueAndOrdersPeriodic

      @Query("SELECT EXTRACT(HOUR FROM o.time) AS hour, COUNT(o.id) AS orders, SUM(o.price) AS revenue FROM Order o WHERE o.time BETWEEN :startDate AND :endDate GROUP BY hour") List<SaleHistoryItem> getRevenueAndOrdersPeriodic(@Param("startDate") Instant startDate, @Param("endDate") Instant endDate)
      Retrieves hourly revenue and order statistics within a specified time period. The query calculates: - `hour`: The hour of the day extracted from the order time. - `orders`: The total number of orders placed during that hour. - `revenue`: The total revenue generated during that hour.
      Parameters:
      startDate - The start date of the time range (inclusive).
      endDate - The end date of the time range (inclusive).
      Returns:
      A list of SaleHistoryItem projections, each containing hourly statistics.
